jobDescription: A 100-unit cooperative building on the Upper West Side constructed in 1913 is seeking a live-in working Superintendent. The building staff consists of seven Local 32BJ employees. The Superintendent will take responsibility for making repairs (in conjunction with the building’s handyman), directing the staff, overseeing the operation and maintenance of the building, and providing services to all residents by interacting and communicating effectively with them. The candidate must have good verbal and written communication skills, including familiarity with current computer technology and work closely with the managing agent and Board of Directors (BOD). The Superintendent must be immediately responsive and on-call for emergencies. At least five years’ experience, training and knowledge of building infrastructure including heating, plumbing, electric, and gas systems is required. A two bedroom apartment will be provided.
